Articles.Content:
As promised, the first successful launch of a Custodian-class defence battlecruiser:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mb77uSbjxyM

In order to get the ship into orbit, the fuel for the main cannons had to be dumped. A refueling mission is under weigh to restore the ship's interplanetary travel capability.

I'm wondering if Macey is going to accept modular stuff. The only things he has been sending so far were to-orbit-in-one-go big ships. What o you guys think? I mean, he has to build a space station someday, right?

While I'm not making any large battle ships, I'm still going to attempt to send him what I have in hopes he finds a use for it. I think the more options he's presented with, the better story and world he can build using our resources.

Macey did ask for space station parts under Aid Ships, if I recall correctly.

But with Spiritwolf's current state, I don't think building a space station ranks high on the priority list.

Hi all!! I have completed my ship, just ironing out a few problems and i will be able to submit. Here are a few pics of it so far.

I call this ship Vigilant Loki.

Hope I please a few peeps:D

Gone through a few changes since posted. Maybe one more change then ill submit but def able to get to laythe

update on ship design

ksp ship ideas : scorptec scrambler sattelite : launches a hail of bits to stop missiles ,And has an armoured front useful for defending something by getting in front of the approaching missile.

scorptec Ram3R : has a strut pole at the front which it uses to ram things

other weapons could include: small anti missile hail, pole

launchers, and maybe a landing gear surrounding that could devastate enemy hollow ships by lowering its gear inside it, And finally a tiny missile pack.

If these ideas interest anyone i will implement our researchers and engineers to build them

remove ALL the fuel lines on the launcher and do it again with desired symmetry i had that issue with my lifter and that was how it ended up getting fixed. also are you still gonna do the battle vids?

The core philosophy of KerbComm Inc. since its inception has been to provide affordable and reliable commercial development of space for the betterment of all Kerbalkind, so officially the very idea of weaponizing space is abhorrent to the company. Unofficially, the non-existent weapons division of KerbComm RND has finished developing the KCX-4 "THOR".

THOR is an autonomous high-orbit self-guided torpedo deployment platform designed to carry 4 self-guided extreme-range Lightning torpedoes. Lightning torpedoes specialize in the destruction of large and ponderous targets such as orbital installations or ground emplacements from any point in a given sphere of influence. As THOR carries 4 of these torpedoes and can be stationed anywhere in system, the THOR platform is designed as a major deterrent to establishing a large scale presence.

The THOR platform is equipped with multiple redundant communications arrays to extend the time it can operate without maintenance before becoming ineffective for accurate weapons deployment. THOR mounts a large battery capacity and a number of solar panels allowing continuous operations, and has a large store on internal Monopropellant and fuel to ensure all lightning torpedoes are launched at full capacity. It features 4 external mounts primarily for lightning torpedoes, but capable of mounting anything with a size 2 universal docking port.

Each Lightning torpedo contains a large store of internal fuel giving it an enormous effective range with the primary nuclear engine. Lightning also mounts 8 secondary radial engines designed for sudden bursts of speed if intercepted or for use on final approach. The front end of the lightning torpedo features a hardened plate and large structural beam granting additional penetration if forced to collide at lower velocities. Lightning torpedoes also mount a moderate battery supply and solar panels, ensuring they can always operate until they strike.

Following the recent defeat at the hands of the Hanland Corporation, Spiritwolf has purchased the blueprints to THOR in order to help restore control of the system. Spiritwolf adamantly denies being a military focused company, so is likely preparing to use the THOR in an effort to force a truce, with the intention to only use it in the most dire circumstances.

Full launch documentation: http://imgur.com/a/z5vZ7

Weapons test: http://imgur.com/a/QuX9d

http://www./download/i9g4iu9reqbgvf9/Thor.craft

In regards to Community Fight Night, I can do it but my part restriction would have to be rather extreme. Because I'm currently making videos off of a laptop I just don't have the capability to hold large engagements. My computer becomes noticably laggy around 300 to 400 parts.

I know my Sentinel can get to Jool, but I'm too unskilled to get an equatorial orbit, thus screwing the mission.

Added on to that, I'm currently managing my Duna mission with the Sentinel, so my time's pretty much full.

Anyone care to do a proof-of-travel for me?

Craft file here.

The latest version is the MK16R2, but that only adds a parachute to the eject pod, as well as making the rovers Duna-capable.

Discussion is good. It keeps people motivated and wanting to make those Laythe capable ships.

Apparently not, half the submissions are mine and I haven't been participating otherwise.

Apparently not, half the submissions are mine and I haven't been participating otherwise.

Well, Macey's been rather quiet these few days, the hype's dying down at last.

Once it quiets down we'll start to see serious submissions, right now it's all "omgIrwantbeinshow"
Most people are also waiting (even macey) for 0.21, to see how it will affect their designs.

Most people are also waiting (even macey) for 0.21, to see how it will affect their designs.

RCS becomes more efficient, standard SAS modules become more useful, all vessels require a lot more power. New parts are mainly probe sized with a sprinkle of 2m adapters.

Anyone care to do a proof-of-travel for me?

Craft file here.

Sentinel makes it to Jool with no problems, but it is one of the most sluggish ships I have ever flown and the cowling on the nuclear engine blows up the entire ship when jettisoned. I would add more RCS and replace the nuke engine with something else.

http://imgur.com/a/KIFdM

Sentinel makes it to Jool with no problems, but it is one of the most sluggish ships I have ever flown and the cowling on the nuclear engine blows up the entire ship when jettisoned. I would add more RCS and replace the nuke engine with something else.

http://imgur.com/a/KIFdM

I realized as much on my Duna mission, I've switched it out in favor of the engine used in Macey's Shades (can't recall the name).

I've added a bit more RCS ports, but it still doesn't seem to turn any faster than awfully slow. Any other ideas?

Edited July 23, 2013 by Mygnol

I realized as much on my Duna mission, I've switched it out in favor of the one used in Macey's Shades (can't recall the name).

I've added a bit more RCS ports, but it still doesn't seem to turn any faster than awfully slow. Any other ideas?

Once 0.21 comes out you can add a bunch of reaction wheels to help it turn. Otherwise it is pretty solid, but I didn't test the rover deployment.

Once 0.21 comes out you can add a bunch of reaction wheels to help it turn. Otherwise it is pretty solid, but I didn't test the rover deployment.

Rover deployment and probe deployment was documented in my Duna mission, it works pretty well, besides the fact that the rover does have a habit of yawing slightly during burns. (RIP Halwell, the nuclear engine killed you)

Also, should I forego the ion engines? With the dV the Sentinel can lug around, I think they're rather redundant.

I just retrofit my ships all they need is reaction wheels.
